title: City of Death
writers: David Agnew (pseudonym for Douglas Adams, Graham Williams)
dialogue_triumphs: Duggan: 'You know what I don't understand?' Romana: 'I expect so.'
Kerensky: 'It's the Jagaroth who need all the chickens, is it?'
The Doctor: '1979 is more of a table wine.'
The Doctor: 'What a wonderful butler, he's so violent.'
The Doctor: 'You're a beautiful woman, probably.'
Scarlioni: 'Nobody could be as stupid as he seems.'
goofs: In episode one, the wrist of Scaroth's monster glove flaps about.
The sketch of Romana seen outside the café is different from the one seen inside.
In episode four Romana wires up a British three-pin plug in order to connect Scaroth's time equipment to the (French) mains.
The prehistoric atmosphere seems quite breathable and there's land to stand on, despite being 400 million years ago.

continuity_notes.name: The Doctor
continuity_notes.description: Time Lord protagonist, currently in his fourth incarnation
continuity_notes.current_status: Traveling with Romana, investigating time disturbances in Paris

continuity_notes.name: Romana
continuity_notes.description: Time Lady companion, currently in her second incarnation
continuity_notes.current_status: Traveling with the Doctor, claims to be 125 years old

continuity_notes.name: TARDIS
continuity_notes.current_status: Functional, with ability to track other time travelers

continuity_notes.name: Sonic Screwdriver
continuity_notes.description: Multipurpose tool used by the Doctor and Romana
continuity_notes.current_status: In use by both the Doctor and Romana

continuity_notes.name: Jagaroth
continuity_notes.description: Ancient warlike alien race with advanced technology
continuity_notes.current_status: Extinct except for Scaroth's fractured existence

roots: Caper movies such as The Pink Panther
links: The Doctor mentions the Daleks and Skaro.

locations.name: Paris
locations.current_status: Setting for the main events of the story in 1979

locations.name: Florence
locations.current_status: Visited in 1505 as part of the story

locations.name: Mid-Atlantic
locations.current_status: Setting for events 400 million years ago

untold_adventures: The Doctor met Leonardo Da Vinci and the model for the Mona Lisa
The Doctor knew Shakespeare and advised him on metaphor, writing out some of Hamlet when Shakespeare sprained his wrist writing sonnets
qv: Aliens and the Origins of Mankind
additional_notes: The story features a cameo appearance by John Cleese. The plot involves multiple copies of the Mona Lisa and time travel affecting Earth's history.
bottom_line: Highly praised as one of the best Doctor Who stories, noted for its wit, plot complexity, and overall quality.
